title: About
text: I’m Grace Remus, a senior studying Sports Media and Mass Communications with a minor in English at the University of Nebraska–Lincoln. My work here has focused on finding new and creative ways to tell stories from the world of sports. Whether it’s through data visualization, design, or written storytelling, I aim to uncover new perspectives and help audiences see the game in a deeper, more meaningful way.

title: How Important are Kickers in Securing Wins?
text:
Are kickers the most important part of a football team? How much do their points matter to a teams’ result


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)


X2024KICKING <- read_csv("data/2024KICKING.csv") |>
  mutate(Team = case_when(
    Team == "DAL" ~ "Dallas Cowboys",
    Team == "PIT" ~ "Pittsburgh Steelers",
    Team == "LAC" ~ "Los Angeles Chargers",
    Team == "HOU" ~ "Houston Texans",
    Team == "MIA" ~ "Miami Dolphins",
    Team == "LVR" ~ "Las Vegas Raiders",
    Team == "IND" ~ "Indianapolis Colts",
    Team == "PHI" ~ "Philadelphia Eagles",
    Team == "LAR" ~ "Los Angeles Rams",
    Team == "ATL" ~ "Atlanta Falcons",
    Team == "DEN" ~ "Denver Broncos",
    Team == "SFO" ~ "San Francisco 49ers",
    Team == "NWE" ~ "New England Patriots",
    Team == "TAM" ~ "Tampa Bay Buccaneers",
    Team == "ARI" ~ "Arizona Cardinals",
    Team == "NOR" ~ "New Orleans Saints",
    Team == "SEA" ~ "Seattle Seahawks",
    Team == "MIN" ~ "Minnesota Vikings",
    Team == "WAS" ~ "Washington Commanders",
    Team == "BAL" ~ "Baltimore Ravens",
    Team == "BUF" ~ "Buffalo Bills",
    Team == "DET" ~ "Detroit Lions",
    Team == "JAX" ~ "Jacksonville Jaguars",
    Team == "CLE" ~ "Cleveland Browns",
    Team == "CAR" ~ "Carolina Panthers",
    Team == "KAN" ~ "Kansas City Chiefs",
    Team == "CHI" ~ "Chicago Bears",
    Team == "TEN" ~ "Tennessee Titans",
    Team == "CIN" ~ "Cincinnati Bengals",
    Team == "GNB" ~ "Green Bay Packers",
    Team == "NYG" ~ "New York Giants",
    Team == "NYJ" ~ "New York Jets"))
nfc_2024 <- read_csv("data/2024NFC.csv")
colnames(nfc_2024)[colnames(nfc_2024) == "Tm"] <- "Team"
nfc_2024 <- nfc_2024 |>
  mutate(Team = gsub("[*+]", "", Team) |> trimws())

nfc_kicking_2024 <- left_join(X2024KICKING, nfc_2024, by = "Team") |>
  filter(Team %in% nfc_2024$Team)

ggplot(nfc_kicking_2024, aes(x = `FG%`, y = `W-L%`)) +
  geom_point(color = "red") +
  labs(
    x = "Field Goal Percentage",
    y = "Win-Loss Percentage",
    title = "Field Goal Percentage compared to Win-Loss Percentage"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()









Here we can see that This graph shows that good kickers may not necessarily make a great team, now lets look at how many point those kickers are actually responsible for.


Code
library(tidyverse)


nfc_kicking_2024 <- nfc_kicking_2024 |>
  mutate(kicker_PTS = FGM_total * 3,
other_PTS = TeamPts - kicker_PTS)


nfc_long <- nfc_kicking_2024 |>
  pivot_longer(
    cols = c(other_PTS,kicker_PTS),
    names_to = "Points_Type",
    values_to = "Points")

ggplot(nfc_long, aes(x = reorder(Team, TeamPts), y = Points, fill = Points_Type)) +
  geom_col() +
  coord_flip() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("kicker_PTS" = "red", "other_PTS" = "dodgerblue"),
                    labels = c("Kicker Points", "Other Points")) +
  labs(title = "Kicker Contribution to Team Points", x = "Team", y = "Points") +
  theme_minimal()









Now onto the last chart which explains blah blah blah


Code
nfc_kicking_2024 <- nfc_kicking_2024 |>
  mutate(kicker_pct = (kicker_PTS / TeamPts) * 100) |>
  filter(FGA_total > 20)

team_colors <- c(
  "Dallas Cowboys" = "#003594",
  "Philadelphia Eagles" = "#004C54",
  "Washington Commanders" = "#5A1414",
  "New York Giants" = "#0B2265",
  "Detroit Lions" = "#0076B6",
  "Minnesota Vikings" = "#4F2683",
  "Green Bay Packers" = "#203731",
  "Chicago Bears" = "#0B162A",
  "Tampa Bay Buccaneers" = "#D50A0A",
  "New Orleans Saints" = "#D3BC8D",
  "Atlanta Falcons" = "#A71930",
  "Carolina Panthers" = "#0085CA",
  "San Francisco 49ers" = "#AA0000",
  "Los Angeles Rams" = "#003594",
  "Seattle Seahawks" = "#002244",
  "Arizona Cardinals" = "#97233F")

ggplot(nfc_kicking_2024, aes(x = kicker_pct, y = SRS, size = kicker_PTS, color = Team)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.8) +
  geom_text_repel(aes(label = Team), hjust = 1.1, vjust = 0.5, size = 3) +
  scale_color_manual(values = team_colors, labels = nfc_kicking_2024$Team) +
  labs(
    title = "Kicker Contribution vs Team Strength (SRS)",
    x = "% of Team Points from Kicker",
    y = "SRS (Team Strength)",
    size = "Kicker Points",
    color = "Kicker"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    legend.position = "none"
  )









Here, you can see the Cowboys have a strong kicker based on points scored, however, that kicker is responsible for almost 35% of his teams’ points. Even the best kicker in the world cannot make up for a lack of scoring by the rest of his team. The Lions are a display of how overall team strength is affected when both the kicker and the offense do their jobs in running up the score.
